alert.note: Alert for Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 3:47AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington Iowa, affecting all counties bordering the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Water floods Andalusias Second Street in the unprotected area. Water is also at the foundations of several homes in Midway Beach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning and continue rising to 18.6 feet Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
